knimeNode.name: Davies-Bouldin Index
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node computes the Davies-Bouldin index for evaluating clustering performance on a dataset.

fullDescription.intro: This node computes the Davies-Bouldin index for evaluating clustering performance on a dataset. Davies-Bouldin index is a usefull and computationally efficient metric for evaluating how well clustering has been performed and help decide the ideal number of clusters the data has to be assigned to. The index takes into account the similarity of each cluster to other clusters. The score retured is non-negative, the lower the score, the better the clusterring result. A low score indicates dense clusters and high distances between cluster centroids.
fullDescription.option: Columns to exclude from the computation.
Columns to include in the computation.
The column that contains the name of the cluster for each point.
If checked, a random subset will be sampled from the dataset. This is recommended for large datasets since computation is resource intensive.
The size of the sample as the proportion of the dataset. It can be in the range from 0.01 to 1.0, where 1.0 uses the whole dataset.
A random seed to be used when randomly sampling the data.

inPort.name: Table with the data and clustering results

ports.inPort: The table with the points and their cluster allocation as a separate column.
ports.outPort: A table with one column that has one row containing the computed score.
